Class BigTwo

  • java.lang.Object
    • BigTwo

  • public class BigTwo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a Big Two card game.
    Author:
    Hu Qiyun

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BigTwo()
      Constructor of BigTwo.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Hand composeHand(CardGamePlayer player, CardList cards)
      This method returns a valid hand from the specified list of cards of the player or null.
      void distributeCards(BigTwoDeck deck)
      This method distributes a shuffled deck of cards to the four players and choose the player who is holding Diamond 3 should start the game.
      void endOfGame(CardGamePlayer winner)
      This method is called when the Big Two Card game ends, prints out the summary of each player.
      int getCurrentIdx()
      Retrieve the index of the current player.
      Deck getDeck()
      Retrieve the deck of cards being used.
      java.util.ArrayList<Hand> getHandsOnTable()
      Retrieve the list of hands played on the table.
      java.util.ArrayList<CardGamePlayer> getPlayerList()
      Retrieve the list of players.
      CardGamePlayer loopOfPlayers()
      This method implements the logic of four players taking turns to give out a hand until the game finishes.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This method starts a Big Two card game.
      void start(BigTwoDeck deck)
      This method starts the game with a (shuffled) deck of cards supplied as the argument, it implements the Big Two game logics.

        public int getCurrentIdx()
        Retrieve the index of the current player.
        Returns:
        The index of the current player.

      • distributeCards

        public void distributeCards(BigTwoDeck deck)
        This method distributes a shuffled deck of cards to the four players and choose the player who is holding Diamond 3 should start the game.
        Parameters:
        deck - A shuffled deck of cards which will be used in the game, we will distribute cards to the four players.

      • loopOfPlayers

        public CardGamePlayer loopOfPlayers()
        This method implements the logic of four players taking turns to give out a hand until the game finishes.
        Returns:
        winner The winner of the game.

      • endOfGame

        public void endOfGame(CardGamePlayer winner)
        This method is called when the Big Two Card game ends, prints out the summary of each player.
        Parameters:
        winner - The winner of the game.

      • start

        public void start(BigTwoDeck deck)
        This method starts the game with a (shuffled) deck of cards supplied as the argument, it implements the Big Two game logics.
        Parameters:
        deck - A shuffled deck of cards which will be used in the game, we will distribute cards to the four players.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method starts a Big Two card game.
        Parameters:
        args - not being used.

      • composeHand

        public static Hand composeHand(CardGamePlayer player,
                               CardList cards)
        This method returns a valid hand from the specified list of cards of the player or null.
        Parameters:
        player - The CardGamePlayer being inspected.
        cards - The cards selected by the player CardGamePlayer.
        Returns:
        A valid Hand from the specified list of cards of the player, or null if there is no valid Hand.
